title: C++ Environment Setup
description: Learn how to set up your C++ coding environment and run your first program.
details: Before writing C++ code, you need a working development environment. In this section, you'll choose a code editor or IDE, install a C++ compiler, and run programs on your computer.
examples: Using an IDE helps detect any syntax errors that appear. (Which they probably will from time to time)
Could give some suggestions when naming a variable or function.
Offers tools to debug your code. Can step through your code through execution to know what exactly is going on.
Helps projects to be organized with files and folders.
